title: Cover blown: How Pakistani 'Priya Sharma' lured Navy clerk to leak Op Sindoor secrets
content: Intelligence agencies arrested Vishal Yadav, a Naval Headquarters UDC, for allegedly spying for Pakistan, receiving payments through bank transfers and cryptocurrency. His activities surfaced during a review of Facebook accounts flagged in a 2022 espionage case. Yadav shared sensitive military information, including updates on military operations, and received payments ranging from Rs 5,000 to Rs 50,000.

title: Kolkata shocker: Student raped on law college premises; staffer among 3 arrested
content: A student reported a rape incident at a Kolkata law college. Police acted swiftly, arresting three individuals. The accused are Manojit Mishra, Zaib Ahmed, and Pramit Mukhopadhyay. One is accused of the assault, while the others allegedly abetted the crime. They will appear in court in Alipore. Police seek custody for further investigation. The victim's identity remains protected.

title: Jaishankar thanks Iran for helping evacuate Indians amid Israel conflict
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar thanked Iran for aiding the safe evacuation of Indian nationals during the recent conflict with Israel. Operation Sindhu, launched on June 18, has brought home over 4,400 Indians via 19 special flights from Iran and Israel. Evacuations occurred from cities like Mashhad, Yerevan, and Ashgabat, even including some nationals from Nepal and Sri Lanka.

title: Exclusive: Gukesh vs Carlsen not happening in Vegas; why is world champion not playing?
content: World Champion D Gukesh will not be playing in the Las Vegas leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, citing exhaustion after Norway Chess. Vidit Gujrathi will replace him, donning Gukesh’s red jacket. The $750,000 event runs July 16–20 at Wynn Las Vegas. Meanwhile, the India leg in September is cancelled, and Jan Henric Buettner will step down as CEO on July 1.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: IND vs ENG: India resume training ahead of 2nd Test; Bumrah sits out net session
content: Following their Headingley defeat, the Indian cricket team has commenced preparations for the second Test against England in Birmingham. Despite Jasprit Bumrah's presence, he refrained from on-field activities, while Prasidh Krishna was also absent from bowling drills. Coach Gautam Gambhir engaged in discussions with pacers, and players participated in net sessions.

title: 'Wanted to kill Khamenei but ...': Israel reveals how Ayatollah evaded assassination
content: During the recent conflict, Israeli defence minister Israel Katz revealed that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was a target for assassination but evaded capture by going into hiding. Despite this, Israel launched airstrikes, killing Iranian commanders and nuclear scientists, aiming to destabilize Iran's leadership.

title: LinkedIn CEO on what you need to do if you don't want AI to kill your job
content: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky warns of significant job market disruption due to AI, highlighting Amazon's workforce reductions as a sign of broader changes. He advises workers to embrace uniquely human skills like communication and collaboration to differentiate themselves.

title: Watch: Elephants go on rampage at Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat
content: During the Rath Yatra celebrations in Ahmedabad, a male elephant became agitated. The incident occurred near Desai ni Pol in Khadia. Authorities swiftly administered a tranquilizer injection. Female elephants helped to herd the male elephant away. No injuries were reported, and the crowd was quickly controlled. The male elephant is now isolated. The remaining 17 female elephants continued the procession.

title: Kolkata horror: TMC, BJP trade barbs over rape case in law college
content: A rape case at a Kolkata law college has sparked political controversy. Trinamool Congress (TMC) blames Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) for delaying the Aparajita Anti-Rape Bill. BJP accuses the Mamata Banerjee government of inaction due to political reasons. Three men, including students and staff, have been arrested in connection with the incident.

title: 'We were told there was a threat': Rohit Sharma spills secrets of IND vs PAK clash
content: Rohit Sharma recalls the electrifying atmosphere surrounding India-Pakistan matches, describing it as a festival-like experience. He lauded Rishabh Pant's crucial innings and the exceptional bowling performance of Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh in the T20 World Cup clash. Sharma emphasized the strategic use of Bumrah and Arshdeep to defend a low total on a challenging pitch.

title: US government warns: Green Cards and Visas at risk; will be revoked if ...
content: USCIS has issued a stern warning, stating that immigrants risk losing their green cards and visas if they break the law. The agency emphasized that advocating violence, supporting terrorism, or encouraging such activities will result in ineligibility to remain in the U.S.

title: Świątek and Azarenka caught in feud as ‘awkward’ handshake breaks the internet
content: A frosty handshake between Iga Świątek and Victoria Azarenka after their match at the French Open has ignited speculation among tennis fans. The brief, cold exchange, devoid of smiles or eye contact, contrasted sharply with the players' usual professionalism. While the reason remains unclear, the moment has become a major talking point, highlighting the intense emotions of elite competition.

title: ‘On the pot during court’: Man attends Gujarat HC virtual hearing from toilet seat
content: A man attending a Gujarat High Court hearing via video conference was caught on camera seated on a toilet, triggering outrage. The incident occurred before Justice Nirzar S Desai's bench on June 20. This follows similar instances of inappropriate behavior in virtual courtrooms, including a litigant smoking.

title: After suspending Indus Treaty with Pak, India considers revising Ganges Treaty with B'desh
content: India is considering revising the Ganges Water Sharing Treaty with Bangladesh, set to expire in 2026. New Delhi seeks a new treaty reflecting its current irrigation, port maintenance, and power generation needs.

title: Mussolini returns to Rome! Italian dictator's great grandson signs for Italian football club
content: Lazio has recalled Romano Floriani Mussolini, great-grandson of Benito Mussolini, after his loan at Juve Stabia, where he made 37 appearances. Despite Juve Stabia's interest in a permanent deal, Lazio opted to bring back the 22-year-old right back. Fascist fan groups are prevalent in Italian football, with Lazio's supporters having ties to the extreme right.

title: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Reddy gets court relief in convoy death case
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has temporarily shielded YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, former Chief Minister and YSRCP chief, from coercive police action in connection with a case involving the death of a party worker. This occurred during a political tour when a vehicle from Reddy's convoy fatally struck a man.

title: Hailee Steinfeld drops jaws while living her best ‘wife life’ with Josh Allen
content: Hailee Steinfeld is currently honeymooning in the Maldives with Josh Allen, showcasing a series of stunning all-white designer outfits. The actress and musician, who recently married, shared images of herself in Cult Gaia ensembles, including a feathered gown and a plissé top with a skirt. She also promoted her Angel Margarita cocktail brand while enjoying the tropical scenery.

title: From stop clock to boundary catches: ICC makes multiple big changes to cricket rules
content: The ICC has introduced significant changes to cricket playing conditions across all formats, including Test, ODI, and T20I. A stop clock will be permanently implemented in Test cricket to address over rates, while ODI ball usage is modified to manage wear and tear.

title: 'Tea by the sea': West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's photo with monkey goes viral - see pics
content: West Bengal's Chief Minister, Mamata Banerjee, recently captivated social media users with heartwarming images of her feeding a monkey. The photos, posted on her Instagram, show Banerjee offering biscuits to the calm animal while sitting on a pavement. Reportedly taken at Digha beach, the post has garnered significant attention.

title: 'Unacceptable': Japan condemns Trump's Hiroshima comparison to Iran strikes
content: Japan has strongly condemned Donald Trump's comparison of US strikes on Iran to the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Survivors and officials expressed outrage, with Nagasaki's mayor calling the comparison 'regrettable'. Hiroshima lawmakers passed a resolution rejecting any justification for nuclear weapons. Trump claimed the strikes 'obliterated' Iran's nuclear capabilities, contradicting intelligence assessments.

title: ‘Operation Narnia’ and 'Red Wedding': How Israel pulled off 'Game of Thrones' on Iran
content: Israel executed strikes against Iran. The operation targeted military leaders and nuclear scientists. It is called 'Red Wedding' and 'Operation Narnia'. US support amplified the effect. Iran's nuclear infrastructure is damaged. Revolutionary Guard leadership is decimated. Israel exposed Iran's weak defenses. A ceasefire is in place. Future talks are uncertain. Iran may accelerate nuclear weaponization. The situation remains tense.

title: Caitlin Clark Sidelined by Injury: Major setback hits Indiana Fever
content: Caitlin Clark is out due to a left groin injury. This happened after a fall in a previous game. The Indiana Fever lost to the Los Angeles Sparks without her. The team is taking a cautious, day-to-day approach. An MRI was conducted. Her absence affects the Fever's offense. The team signed Aari McDonald to help the backcourt.

title: IND vs ENG – Warning bells! 'To win in England, India have got to play Kuldeep Yadav'
content: Following India's underwhelming bowling performance in the first Test, former cricket stars Michael Clarke and Nick Knight have urged the inclusion of Kuldeep Yadav. Clarke criticized India's selection strategy, emphasizing the need to prioritize wicket-taking over bolstering batting depth.

title: Internal war in K'taka Cong? What CM Siddaramaiah said on minister's claim
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed claims of internal disputes and potential political shifts within the state government, refuting statements made by minister KN Rajanna. Rajanna had earlier hinted at possible changes after September due to multiple power centers within the Congress, fueling speculation of a cabinet reshuffle or even a change in CM.

title: Cash in hand, killers on call: Mother-daughter love triangle ends in husband’s killing
content: A newlywed man was murdered in a meticulously planned conspiracy orchestrated by his wife and her lover. The illicit affair fueled the crime, as they hired contract killers and used GPS tracking to monitor the victim's movements.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ box office day 8: Movie crosses Rs 90 cr in first week
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' has grossed over Rs 90 crore in its first week, a significant achievement for a film relying on positive word-of-mouth. While initial earnings were strong, the film experienced a slight decline mid-week. The movie faces competition from new releases like Kajol's 'Maa' and the South Indian film 'Kannapa', potentially impacting its future box office performance.

title: Congress takes jab at Centre as Trump teases 'great' trade deal with India
content: Amidst Donald Trump's announcement of an impending 'very big deal' with India, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has criticised the Centre, linking it to the 'abrupt' conclusion of Operation Sindoor. Trump's repeated claims of using trade discussions to halt India-Pakistan confrontations have been met with skepticism. Ramesh suggests India is learning about crucial decisions from Washington DC.

title: India-US trade deal: Energy, & low tariffs - what will be in 'very big' pact
content: Trade talks between India and the US are gaining momentum, potentially leading to a significant agreement. President Trump hinted at a "very big" deal to open up India, focusing on sectors like energy, agriculture, and defense.

title: 'Avoid new complexities': Rajnath's message to China after firm stance on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Chinese counterpart, Dong Jun, in Qingdao during the SCO Defence Ministers' Meeting, where they discussed the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Suspended initially due to Covid-19 in 2020 and later due to the Galwan Valley clash, the pilgrimage is now set to resume. Singh also gifted Dong Jun a Madhubani painting from Bihar as a gesture of goodwill.

title: ‘Like H-1B without lottery’: What is O-1 visa? check details
content: The O-1 visa is gaining traction among professionals and companies as an alternative to the H-1B, offering a route to work in the US for those with extraordinary abilities. With rising O-1A approvals and a high success rate, STEM graduates, researchers, and artists are increasingly pursuing this option.

title: 'Never accepted Constitution': Congress hits back at RSS
content: Jairam Ramesh of Congress has strongly criticized the RSS for allegedly never accepting the Indian Constitution and attacking its framers. This response follows RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's remark questioning the inclusion of "Socialist" and "Secular" in the Constitution. Ramesh highlighted past calls by the RSS and BJP for a new Constitution, which he claims were rejected by the public.

title: 'Constitution in hand' politics: EAM mocks Rahul, blames 'family' for Emergency
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has criticised the Congress party and Rahul Gandhi for their alleged hypocrisy regarding constitutional values, pointing to their failure to apologise for the Emergency. He accused them of flashing the Constitution without truly respecting its spirit, highlighting the Emergency as a dark period where national spirit was suppressed.

title: US-China trade deal: After Trump, China says details of deal ‘confirmed’
content: The US and China have finalized a trade deal, with the US agreeing to cancel restrictive measures, according to China. This follows earlier discussions and a negotiation framework established in London. China is expediting rare earth export approvals, a crucial element in high-tech manufacturing, while both economies have faced negative impacts from trade tensions, including declining manufacturing profits and economic slowdown.

title: 'Brightest blast I've ever seen': Fighter pilot recalls Iran strike by B-2 bombers
content: In June 2025, the US military executed 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' a strike on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, culminating years of meticulous planning and weapon development. The mission, authorized by President Trump, involved B-2 crews deploying GBU-57 bunker-busters to target the facility's vent shafts. While the US asserts 'total obliteration,' Iran disputes the impact, though the IAEA confirmed extensive damage.

title: Language row to unite Thackeray brothers? What Sanjay Raut said
content: Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray are joining forces. They will protest the mandatory Hindi language imposition in Maharashtra schools. Sanjay Raut announced a joint march on July 5. This collaboration marks a significant moment. It is a united front on Marathi identity. The leaders aim to protect language rights. They want to prevent division on this crucial issue.

title: 'Will you let me sleep?': Shikhar reveals smuggling girlfriend into room shared with Rohit Sharma; Hitman said ...
content: Shikhar Dhawan, in his autobiography, revealed a past relationship during the 2006 India A tour to Australia. He secretly brought his girlfriend into his hotel room, shared with Rohit Sharma, leading to distractions and impacting his performance. A senior selector spotted them, and despite the romantic interlude, Dhawan later had a successful international career.

title: Watch: Elope? Sanjana Ganesan silences Jasprit Bumrah with hilarious one-liner
content: Despite Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul in the first innings, India faced a five-wicket defeat against England in the first Test at Headingley. Off-field, a pre-marriage anecdote shared by his wife, Sanjana Ganesan, on 'Who's The Boss' added a light-hearted touch.

title: Russia will deliver two more S-400 squadrons to India by 2026-27
content: Russia has assured India that the remaining two squadrons of the S-400 Triumf missile systems will be delivered by 2026-27, despite delays caused by the Russia-Ukraine war. These systems played a crucial role during Operation Sindoor against Pakistan last month. India is also developing its own air defence system, Project Kusha, with operational deployment planned for 2028-2029.

title: Puri Jagannath Rath Yatra 2025: Best wishes, quotes, images to share with your loved ones
content: The Puri Jagannath Rath Yatra, a grand festival in Odisha, will happen on June 27, 2025. Devotees celebrate Lord Jagannath's journey with his siblings to the Gundicha Temple. Sharing wishes and messages on this auspicious day is a common practice. People use Facebook and WhatsApp statuses to express their devotion.

title: 'Your clothes, slippers came from us': BJP MLA’s comment sparks row
content: Former Maharashtra minister Babanrao Lonikar ignited controversy by criticizing youths for social media criticism despite benefiting from government schemes. His remarks drew swift condemnation from opposition leaders, who deemed them arrogant and insulting. Chief Minister Fadnavis also reprimanded Lonikar, emphasizing the inappropriateness of such statements, especially given the government's service-oriented approach.

title: 'Very big one': Trump hints India, US on cusp of 'great' trade deal; 10 points
content: US President Donald Trump hinted at a significant trade deal with India, following a recent agreement with China. Negotiations are underway in Washington, led by Chief Negotiator Rajesh Agarwal, aiming to bridge gaps in the proposed bilateral agreement.

title: JSW Paints to acquire AkzoNobel India; deal valued at Rs 8,986 crore
content: JSW Paints will acquire a 74.76% stake in Akzo Nobel India (ANIL) from Akzo Nobel NV for up to Rs 8,986 crores. The deal, pending regulatory approval and a tender offer, brings brands like Dulux into the JSW fold. JSW aims to build the next-generation paint company, leveraging ANIL's strong market position.

title: Will pad up and bat if captain tells me to: Kanhaiya on contesting Bihar polls
content: If the captain tells me to sit outside and deliver drinks for those at the crease, I will do that. And if the captain tells me to, I will also pad up and bat, says Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar

title: Farms in Sogane flooded during rains as four tanks were filled up to construct Shivamogga airport
content: Rainwater that used to collect in those tanks is released to the left bank canal of the Bhadra Reservoir Project, that passes close to the airport compound wall

title: Suspects involved in last week blast CRPF camp held; attacks in three towns foiled: Himanta
content: The 'key person' involved with the plan is still absconding, though police have his whereabouts and he will be nabbed soon, Mr. Sarma said.

title: Singaiah death case: Andhra Pradesh High Court grants interim protection to Jagan Mohan Reddy till July 1
content: Justice Y. Lakshmana Rao gave the relief to Jagan Mohan Reddy while hearing his writ petition to quash the FIR and adjourned it to the above date

title: Motorists will soon be able to know highway route attracting least toll amount
content: The Rajmargyatra app provides travellers with comprehensive information about national highways and also offers them an efficient grievance redressal mechanism.

title: Two dialysis machines installed at Sandur taluk hospital in Karnataka by JSW Foundation
content: The machines are intended to provide dialysis treatment at no cost to patients from economically disadvantaged backgrounds across Sandur taluk

title: Gujarat High Court extends Asaram's temporary bail in rape case till July 7
content: The division Bench of Justices Ilesh Vora and Sandeep Bhatt extended Asaram's temporary bail, granted on March 28 initially for three months, during the hearing of the plea

title: Teen stabbed to death, two others injured in Uttar Pradesh’s Ballia
content: Based on a complaint lodged by Golu's brother, Dilip Yadav, an FIR has been registered against seven people...The FIR has also been registered against five unidentified persons, a police officer said

title: Gang rape in Kolkata law college shows female students not safe in State: BJP's West Bengal president Sukanta Majumdar
content: “The incident comes after the rape-murder of a doctor in the R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital last year, an incident that triggered protests across the country,” Sukanta Majumdar said

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder case: Meghalaya Police seize gun, ₹50,000 from accused, further interrogation to follow
content: The police official added that the accused will be interrogated to find out if the laptops used by the accused were discarded or hidden somewhere."

title: Tamil Nadu engineering college admission rank list released; counselling for general category to begin on July 14
content: There will be three rounds and candidates will get 5 days to report to college after provisional allotment

title: Man injured as elephant runs amok during Rath Yatra in Ahmedabad
content: The grand procession, which rolled on from the 400-year-old Jagannath temple, is expected to return by 8 p.m. after making its way through the old city.

title: CBSE announces timetable for Class 10 and 12 supplementary examination 2025
content: The Class 10 supplementary exams will commence on July 15 and conclude on July 22 whereas the Class 12 supplementary exams are to be held and completed on July 15

title: Amarnath Yatra in Jammu: More than 180 companies of Paramilitary forces deployed, says IGP
content: The 38-day-long yatra is scheduled to start on July 3 from the twin routes leading to the 3,880-metre-high holy cave shrine of Amarnath

title: Jaishankar says SCO statement without terrorism reference unacceptable to India
content: “In the discussion on outcome document of the Defence Ministers’ meeting, one country — you can guess which one — said ‘no we don’t want reference to that’,” said Jaishankar.

title: Brihaspathi Tech setting up CCTV plant near Hyderabad with ₹70 crore
content: AI surveillance, security solutions provider that counts BSF, Telangana HC, Election Commission of India among customers raised $10 million recently, eyes public issue in 2026-27

title: MLA ‘Poovai’ Jagan Moorthy non-cooperative, must be arrested: CB-CID at Madras High Court in Tiruvallur teen kidnap case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran decides to pass orders on his anticipatory bail petition during the course of the day

title: Theft at Kerala High Court judge's residence, six grams of gold of private secretary missing
content: An officer of Kalamassery police station said the theft occurred on June 23 and a complaint regarding this was received on June 26

title: BBMP Restructuring Committee members among 53 persons to receive Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Award in Bengaluru
content: The awards will be conferred at an event in Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) headquarters on June 27 evening

title: Zohran Mamdani's win should be an example for Congress: Digvijaya Singh
content: "The method of campaigning in cities by Mamdani is an example for Congress. Will we dare? Are we ready to raise our voice against injustice?" the Congress MP posted on X in Hindi

title: Lord Murugan conference: AIADMK ‘remained silent’ on video clip criticising Annadurai fearing BJP, says Chidambaram
content: Mr. Chidambaram said the AIADMK dignitaries who attended the conference should have walked out of the venue when a video clip criticising the Dravidian stalwarts was played at the event held in Madurai on June 22.

title: Retired HMT employees await retirement benefits; coordinator says more than 40 colleagues died without receiving dues
content: Many of them, now elderly and ailing, allege that they were denied basic entitlements such as gratuity, provident fund, and leave encashment

title: ONGC caps Assam gas well blowout after fortnight-long effort
content: Well No. RDS-147A in Sivasagar district sealed following coordinated operation; 1,500 villagers had been evacuated as precaution

title: Arrests made in Haryana’s Aravalli forest fire, says Nuh Deputy Commissioner
content: According to police, plastic pickers dumping plastic and chemical waste on the ground caused incidents of fire.

title: JSK – Janaki vs State of Kerala row: Malayalam film bodies to protest before CBFC office in Kerala capital
content: Protest on June 30 against ‘arbitrary film certification’ adopted by Central Board of Film Certification

title: Congress 'appeasement' of illegal immigrants led to massive encroachment of Satra land: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma affirmed the BJP-led ruling dispensation's commitment to reclaim the land for these Vaishnavite monasteries

title: Bihar Assembly polls: No confusion or dispute in Mahagathbandhan on Tejashwi being face for CM's post, says Kanhaiya Kumar
content: Kanhaiya Kumar asserted that issues would be paramount in the polls and there was "a conspiracy" by rivals to divert attention by raking up the matter of the coalition's CM face.

title: JD(S) leader Nikhil Kumaraswamy demands white paper on Kalyana Karnataka funding, development
content: JD(S) leader raised pointed questions about the effectiveness of the ₹5,000 crore said to be earmarked for the development of Kalyana Karnataka

title: Kerala govt allocates ₹122 crore to KSRTC in financial assistance
content: Of this, ₹72 crore has been allocated for pension distribution, while the remaining ₹50 crore is the financial assistance to the public utility, including for paying the overdraft dues

title: Telangana Govt to digitise Cabinet meeting files henceforth
content: The State cabinet will convene a status review meeting every three months with focus on reviewing Action Taken Reports (ATRs) of decisions made in previous meetings

title: Evacuated over 4,400 Indian nationals from Iran, Israel in 19 special flights so far, says MEA
content: A fresh batch of 173 Indians evacuated from Iran reached Delhi late Thursday (June 26, 2025) night in a flight from Armenian capital Yerevan, the MEA said

title: Congress questions transparency in India-U.S. trade talks after Trump remarks
content: Jairam Ramesh says key policy decisions affecting India now being announced from Washington, seeks clarity from Prime Minister

title: Kerala rains: Many rural schools remain closed in Kozhikode district
content: Shutters of Kakkayam dam in Kozhikode and Banasura Sagar dam in Wayanad opened following heavy inflow from catchment areas

title: Trump says 'very big' trade deal coming up with India
content: Donald Trump’s remarks come as an Indian team arrived in Washington for the next round of trade talks with the U.S.

title: How the new U.S. visa rules affect your online privacy | Explained
content: Privacy experts have slammed the U.S. government’s new social media vetting requirements, likening the country’s approach to that of an authoritarian regime. However, they note it is difficult to claim that privacy laws are being broken as visa applicants can choose to ignore the request, though they put their visa application at risk by doing so

title: Alcaraz-Fognini among key Wimbledon openers
content: Carlos Alcaraz will begin his quest for a third straight Wimbledon title against dangerous Italian Fabio Fognini, and women's top seed Aryna Sabalenka will open her campaign versus Canadian qualifier Carson Branstine.

title: Sources: Team in top five told not to pick Bailey
content: Ace Bailey's representatives informed a team drafting inside the top five that they didn't want that team to select the Rutgers wing and that he wouldn't report if it did, sources told ESPN.

title: 76ers draft Broome, Suns land Fleming in Round 2
content: Johni Broome went to the 76ers with the No. 35 pick while Rasheer Fleming ended up with the Suns via trade as the NBA draft wrapped up.

title: Rays' Franco found guilty in sexual abuse case
content: Rays shortstop Wander Franco was found guilty of sexual abuse of a minor in the Dominican Republic and received a suspended two-year prison sentence Thursday.

title: Sources: Texas State closing on move to Pac-12
content: Texas State officials began alerting Sun Belt officials of its formal offer to the Pac-12 and plans to accept, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets fear Canning has Achilles injury, await MRI
content: The Mets' Griffin Canning is set to undergo imaging after leaving Thursday's start because of a noncontact injury, and the team fears it's his Achilles.

title: Alabama gets commitment from No. 3 RB Crowell
content: Alabama secured its highest-ranked commitment in the 2026 class Thursday when four-star rusher Ezavier Crowell, ESPN's No. 3 running back prospect and No. 2 recruit from the state of Alabama, committed to the Crimson Tide.

title: Hayes on Lavelle's stellar return: 'Only one Rose'
content: Rose Lavelle scored a goal and added an assist in her first international minutes in nearly seven months Thursday as the United States beat Ireland 4-0 at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado.

title: 🏈 One last offseason move for every NFL team
content: Which signings, trades and extensions should still happen this offseason? We suggested one final move for every NFL team as we near training camp.

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.﻿

title: Final 2025 NHL mock draft: Predictions for the top 32 picks
content: While the top two picks appear to be locked in, what happens after that? Here's the final projection before Friday's first round.

title: NHL draft buzz: Sharks not set at No. 2?
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: Cal Raleigh, Aaron Judge and the best power half-seasons in MLB history
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and if they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: The two ends of the NFL contract spectrum: Team- and player-friendly deals at six positions
content: We picked out deals that favor the team's salary cap (Sam Darnold) and deals that favor the player's bank account (Jaycee Horn) at key positions.

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: 5 questions the USMNT must answer in Gold Cup knockouts (and before 2026 World Cup)
content: The USMNT finished the Gold Cup group stage without a loss, and yet no one seems particularly comforted by that. These five questions need answers ASAP.

title: Chavez? Tyson? Canelo? Inside the process to pick a Jake Paul opponent
content: Andreas Hale talks to Jake Paul, his team and other matchmakers to explain the challenges of finding the right matchup.

title: 'The search for a QB1 in Cleveland continues': Blue Jays troll Browns, Guardians after error
content: Toronto trolled two Cleveland teams with a jab at the Browns' quarterback situation after a Guardians error.

title: Yankees announce George Costanza bobblehead giveaway for Aug. 21
content: The bobblehead coincides with the New York Yankees hosting "Seinfeld Night" against the Boston Red Sox.

title: Cooper Flagg, Derik Queen and other Montverde Academy stars' NBA path
content: Four of the Florida high school's Class of 2024 starting five were selected as first-rounders in this year's draft.

title: Club World Cup Daily: Madrid win group, Man City get dominant win over Juventus
content: Real Madrid's 3-0 win over RB Salzburg sees them win Group H on the final day of group stage action. Here's what you need to know from Wednesday's Club World Cup action.

title: Vini: Assist for Valverde 'one of the best' of career
content: Vinícius Júnior said his backheel assist for Federico Valverde in Real Madrid's 3-0 Club World Cup win over Salzburg on Thursday was "one of the best of my career."

title: Haaland outpaces Messi, Mbappé to 300 goals
content: Erling Haaland scored the 300th goal of his career for club and country as Manchester City defeated Juventus at the Club World Cup.

title: Real Madrid advance, set up Juventus CWC clash
content: Real Madrid sealed their passage to the Club World Cup round of 16 as Group H leaders, defeating Salzburg 3-0 on Thursday night at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia.

title: Athletic press LaLiga on Barça signing Williams
content: Athletic Club have confirmed they met with LaLiga to question Barcelona's ability to sign players within the league's financial fair play rules amid the Catalan side's ongoing pursuit of Nico Williams.

title: Pep: 'Long time' since Man City played this well
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola said his players got the chance to remember "what it was like to be a good team" as they thrashed Juventus 5-2.

title: Mexico's Chávez out of Gold Cup after tearing ACL

title: Search operation to track down three JeM terrorists underway in J&K’s Basantgarh

title: Is India plumbing the depths of groundwater?
content: Water-intensive agriculture and urban demand mean that India is using almost 60% of its groundwater every year. Governments have tried to increase supply, reduce demand and regulate consumption. But are these enough?

title: First energy-efficient building of Andhra Pradesh to be inaugurated in Vizag today
content: Constructed on an energy-efficient model and equipped with energy-efficient appliances, the building will help save electricity bills, says APEPDCL CMD

title: A tightrope walk for Chittoor’s mango farmers
content: Mango farmers in Chittoor, which registered a bumper yield of over 10 lakh tonnes this season, are staring at massive losses as they are forced to sell their produce for a meagre ₹4 a kg, far from the government mandated ₹8, owing to delayed procurement by pulp-making units in the district. Poor MSP enforcement, alleged collusion among factories, and logistical bottlenecks arising out of global conflicts have exacerbated their plight, writes K Umashanker

title: Free seat hopes dashed as pvt. schools step back citing fee reimbursement dues in Andhra Pradesh
content: Poor students who were initially offered free admissions under the Right to Education (RTE) Act, have later been denied the same by some corporate schools citing lack of timely support from the government, parents in limbo as they have given up ‘Thalli ki Vandanam’ benefit also

title: Railings on footpaths push people on to the margins of roads
content: The YMCA intersection deals with a large volume of pedestrians, bus commuters and metro rail users, who primarily move towards the Jubilee Bus Station and getting quickly onto the footpath, especially after getting off buses is difficult

title: Telangana’s medical college expansion: Built to heal, left to rot
content: From shuttered duty rooms and unsafe hostels to sprawling, unopened hospitals, Telangana’s bold push to set up a government medical college in every district has resulted in an overstretched, understaffed system. Students are left to teach themselves, doctors go unpaid and faculty shortage cripple learning. Siddharth Kumar Singh exposes a public healthcare vision mired in delays, neglect and a widening gap between promise and practice

title: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla’s family meet U.P. CM Adityanath after his ISS entry

title: The big AI shake-up in Bengaluru
content: While Bengaluru is home to more than a lakh artificial intelligence professionals, AI has also brought with it fears of job loss. title: Woman Wants To Access Dead Son's 'Frozen Semen'. Bombay High Court Steps In
content: The Bombay High Court, in an interim order, has directed a city-based fertility centre to preserve the frozen semen of a deceased unmarried man pending hearing of a petition by his mother who wants to use the fluid to continue the family line.

title: Gangster's Nephew Shot Dead In Delhi, London-Based Don Link Emerges

title: Temple Demolished In Dhaka, India Urges Bangladesh To Protect Hindus
content: The demolition of a Durga Temple in Dhaka had led to a sharp response from India over the treatment of minorities in Bangladesh. Authorities in Bangladesh have justified the move, calling it a 'makeshift structure', built illegally.

title: How Fish Farming Is Transforming Former Naxalites In Jharkhand

content: The deep penetrating bombs that the U.S. dropped into two Iranian nuclear facilities were designed specifically for those sites and were the result of more than 15 years of intelligence and weapons design work.
